general: Ampicillin (and Amoxicillin) are the aminopenicillins with predictable activity against streptococci, most enterococci, Listeria, clostridia and a variety of other anaerobic bacteria.

renal_adjustment.crcl_or_egfr: CrCl >50: No dosage adjustment. CrCl 30-50: 1-2 gm q6-8h. CrCl 10-30: 1-2 gm q8-12h
renal_adjustment.hemodialysis: 1-2 gm q12h (give one of the dialysis day doses AD)

other_adjustment: ECMO. Serum concentrations may not be significantly altered by ECMO. See Table for details.
adverse_effects: Allergy manifest as rash is common with all beta-lactam antibiotics, including Ampicillin.

In patients with Epstein-Barr virus (infectious mononucleosis) given Ampicillin, 65-100% develop rash; 90% of CLL patients and 15-20% of patients who take allopurinol. Do not label patient as penicillin-allergic as it is not a true allergy.
In patients with true Ampicillin allergy, risk of cross-allergenicity with po cephalosporins that have identical R1 side chains: i.e., Cefaclor, Cephalexin, Cephradine, Loracarbef.

Ampicillin: Fever, rash (5%), anaphylaxis (rare), +Coombs, neutropenia, eosinophilia (22%), thrombocytopenia (rare), increased PT/PTT, nausea/vomiting (2%), diarrhea (10%), C. difficile colitis (rare).

pregnancy_risk.fda_risk_category: No evidence of toxicity in humans or animals
pregnancy_risk.lactation: Milk concentrations low, adverse effects not expected. Monitor infant for GI toxicity.
pregnancy_risk.footnote: Capital letter = Old FDA risk category; Text = New FDA risk category

pharmacology.preparations: Cap (250, 500 mg), Oral susp (125 mg/5 mL, 250 mg/5 mL), Injection
